one_reviews_text: Dang near feels like working on a real car.  Looking forward to seeing more content added to this game.

review_title: It was on my quest and it disappeared
one_reviews_text: Had this game on my quest 2. Played it once and now there is no trace of it. Went on the phone app and bought it again and it refuses to find my headset to install. Just says can't find headset.

review_title: on quest 2 via Airlink missing sound
one_reviews_text: i just got a wrench for quest 2 i play via airlink and i can't hear the sound in that game. Does anyone have the same problem?

Hi I just got this game. It is excellent by the way well worth the money. Question for the Devs though, do you plan to make it stand alone for the quest 2 in the future. Oculus air doesn't work great for me as my internet isn't great and  running oculus link is also a pain. That being said it is a really well made game

This game will probably only appeal to some people, but you will probably know if you want to get it by looking at it.

If you are considering it is brilliant and the devs are active and responsive in their discord server and update the game well and in good time.

I was amazed at the detail that was put into everything, with complete engine rebuilds possible and rewarding and detailed. Not only this but the ability to simulate racing with the car you tune/build is a great sign of things to come despite it's early stage of development.

I could not recommend this game enough

I am completely in love with this VR game. It is both an educational and highly entertaining game that will keep you coming back to play car mechanic. If you have ever wanted to fully understand car engines and work on them this is your chance to do so, and without oil and grime on your hands that won't wash off!
Even in EA this game is the pinnacle of VR technology with both DLSS and Ray Tracing support. It is probably one of the best looking games and I look forward to seeing how they will build out this game with more content. The only downside is you need a pretty hefty system to enjoy all the eye candy. Otherwise 10/10.

I really enjoy playing this game but it might not be for everyone. Its very detailed so if you like cars and want to learn more about how they work, then you will like playing this. A lot of the gameplay is quite monotenous though and consists of, waiting for fluids to drain/fill, screwing and unscrewing a bunch of screws, and walking back and forth to grab different tools in your shop. I personally find this quite relaxing but you might find it boring. The game is pretty polished at the moment for what it is, but its clear the devs still have a lot of things they want to add.
The concept of the game is awesome, but, I wish the whole movement system was better.
i love the game its basicaly a garge at 22 pound its the game i could of dreamed for and im going to playing again and again
wont even let me play it have anyone else having this problems

Awesome,  I love it !!!!!     Will wrench be coming to the  quest anytime in the future ???

Ty gene
pretty gud

We have had this for several months and love it. I teach high school and use this as a demo for several systems. Keep coming out with more to maintain and service. This is great at show using air tools and the importance of torque wrenches. My only complaint is that the tablet can be difficult to read, but you get used to where things are over time. Thank you for the great product. Please keep up the great work.

Very interesting !

I've always wanted to learn how to take a car apart, and now I have the chance!

It would be nice to have a mechanical part of the motorcycles (Harley Davidson), I bought the software and I give my full support!

An Italian translation would also be nice!

Thank you

dont usually leave reviews, but having just purchased my Rift S, this is what VR was made for, still on the tutorial, feels like i have spent a night in the garage I dont own!

tinkering with an engine without getting cold and dirty, looking forward to hours of fun, can now dream of this having a motorbike add on/alternative, this is more than a game, this is Virtual Reality!!!! - well done

I know a little bit about cars but I've always wanted to learn more and I was blown away by this.  It's literally like shop class in VR, it's very impressive and the design is quite good.  The only comment I would make (and the only thing keeping me from giving this 5 stars) is that some of the parts of the tutorials are pretty vague.  You need to do something in a very specific way and sometimes the explanations aren't too detailed.  For instance when you're putting bolts in to the top of the engine in the third tutorial I think it is, and you need to alternate between bolts in a pattern while tightening them to 76Nm or something like that (I'm going off memory here).  It doesn't say anything about how I tell whether they are tightened enough, if there are any special techniques needed.  Can I put all the bolts in ahead of time or do I have to insert them one at a time as well to complete the tutorial successfully?  I ended up just ending the tutorial but I'll go back to it and try to figure it out later.  Some sort of practical walkthrough of what's expected would be useful for people if they get stuck.  Otherwise, fantastic simulator that I'm sure I'll be spending a lot of time in.

I love parts of this simulator and it's great watching my 12 year old play this over and over. I play on it as well.  What I don't understand is why you can't change the spark plugs. No matter what wrench i grab it won't let me take them off. So I figure maybe I can just keep removing things from the engine to get to them. Nope. So i look for any instruction. Can't find any. So please, tell me what I need to do. Or what am I missing. I know how to change spark plugs in real life. So please tell me how to find help in this game that relates to issues playing so I can easily see if it's a glitch or something I need to learn so I don't spend hours just looking for answers
review_feedback:
Hello,
You need to use a socket extension to reach the spark plugs. In VR extensions are toggled through the context menu (A or X key)

one_reviews_text: Need help to find extention bar to change plugs, can't change tool belt to show this bar.  A or X buttons only bring up the belt

This has got to be the best mechanic simulator I have *EVER* played.   I have not touched Car Mechanic Simulator in any of its flavors since. 

This is how it should be done.. with tons more to come, according to the roadmap. 

These guys have not slowed down since I purchased this Early Access title a while back.   If you LOVE being a mechanic this is the game for you.  Certainly NOT an arcade title.

This program is good to play, has great ongoing potential and is very well made. I appreciate the development team's responsiveness to problems and continued improvement of the game. From a learning perspective it would be good to see some electronics simulated and purhaps modern electronic testing equipment. Also, a 'hint/cheat' as to the cause of a problem would be handy :-)
review_feedback: Thanks for the review. We pushed a hotfix last night that should resolve all of the part bugs related to the physics change.

one_reviews_text: This is more than a game, its inspiring and educational too. I've always been into engines but it is a dark art that unless you have a go or someone teaches you, its hard to get the courage to do it yourself. Inspiring in the sense it has made me want to pick up my tools and get more adventurous. Educational, as these are real life engines and I'm learning some good basics. I'm really looking forward to any future advanced engineering tutorials this team releases.

review_title: Keep it up guys! I mean it!
one_reviews_text: I tried the demo version of this game, and it absolutely fulfilled my expectations. This is a great example of what VR is capable of in certain fields. Entertaining and educating people at the same time. I put this on my wishlist, and was waiting for a discount, but then I played it again and realized, this is not even a steep price for the content, plus I have to support these guys! Everyone should support developers like them who deliver this quality on VR today. Well done so far, and I hope you really keep implementing new parts, mechanics, machines, etc into it. I would even pay for DLC packs, just keep up the good work!

Best feature of all: If the engine blows, you're not out a real $2,000!

I played the demo, and my mind was blown. Why? Because I have a DOHC inline-4 sitting in my garage just waiting to be rebuilt, but have never mustered up the courage due to a fundamental lack of experience - UNTIL NOW! The engine in the demo was nearly identical to the motor I'm rebuilding - it was so encouraging (and fascinating) to visually inspect every part and see how each and every piece fits together, and in which order! So many times I had to take that darn oil pan off again! I finally learned to just put that on last. >_<

Now I'm playing the game, and I'll be sure to give my thoughts when I'm ready. For now, 5 stars because I want this to succeed - You could literally change the education system and the way people learn with this sort of approach to problem solving.

I have long been a fan of the Mazda Miata. The entire vehical since its introduction has been a platform for some of the most impressive custom builds I have ever seen or drive.
Being a builder and owner of 3 Exomotive Exocets I will say hands down this is BY FAR THE ABSOLUTE BEST LEARNING TOOL FOR ANYONE WHO WANTS TO LEARN HOW TO BUILD A MIATA OR EXOCET.

The detail has left me speechless. Yes the controls are slighly odd and I would give the control setup a 90%. But it is still an exceptional piece of gaming and for a first release it surpasses nearly 90% of all the other VR titles to date with not having bugs or any issues that I could find.

I expect great things from this studio going forward.

Excelent work development team.

It's a pleasure to play this game, really complete and all, must have for people wanting to build stuff in general.

However: Sometimes I'm just lost... Like "Why it isn't working" or just "How the F* am i supposed to do that" because sometimes it's not explained (or I didn't found it). I mean not knowing how to go further sometimes must be the biggest problem of this game (And i'm not sure I really want to go and see how to change brakefluid on a real car on ytb in order to play this game). The controls are a littler wanky at the start, and the walking speed is just TOO SLOW, the robotic voice is more or less killing me, I HATE IT... But to be honest those are not big problems... 

Feel free to put some music when you're playing because there's almost no sound and sometimes changing a tire can seem a bit bland.
Please add multiplayer... imagine building together ;}

review_title: After a patch it should be perfect
one_reviews_text:
Firstly, I really want to express how much I want this game to succeed. You've done an awesome job at really cramming in every detail, while still having it be a fun experience to people just interested in learning how it all works from the ground up. If you've even remotely interested in building things or you liked legos as a kid, this is like the "how to build a car from absolutely scrath for dummies with a bit of patience and basic problem solving skills".

However, I was using the part collector (trigger) and the parts seem to get stuck and become un-grabbable after the fact. There's some other small bugs that can be a bit frustrating, especially since I'm not finished with the tutorial yet, but hopefully you'll get around to fixing this stuff soon.

Other than the (mostly) small bugs, it really is an incredible game! I just want to be able to finish the tutorial :'(

review_title: Great but needs a lot of work
one_reviews_text: Amazing simulation and detailed assembling! PLEASE do work on making the interface MUCH simpler and guide the player better. I think most people are intersted in how stuff assemble and how it works then spending hours trying to figure it out by themselves

review_title: Best Game For VR Must Have!
one_reviews_text: This game is great for those who want to learn more about how engines work and how they go together its very infomative and scratches that itch. When i played the demo and relized this game hadnt been released yet i was extreamly sad and have been waiting for it to drop since. If you like cars or engines in general or just want a fun game buy this! Or try the demo first then buy this.
I might never play it but i had to add this to my library and support ther devs for their good job done.

I just down loaded the game, and does not allow me to work on anything. I skipped through the tetorial because I traid the Demo vertion and already new the stuff in the demo. When in the shop I am just sitting there and can not fugure out how to get a car to work on. 
Giving it a two star until I get a respnse ane can get into game, then maybe give more stars.

Update: conclusion was that it did not want to start unless I finished tutorial of engine build after I stat it. I just skipped doing it, since I already new.
